HDG.IM.content: spirit is what sustains/rules, first & last [first last], not merely indispensable 3rd element > cultural values secure meaning, restricted to their standards of self-validity: poetry for poetry’s sake, art for art’s sake, science for science’s sake > [no longer question thus no longer spiritual?] > re: science and situation of university, a situation unchanged despite some cleansing [Nazi?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: spirit is what sustains/rules, first & last [first last], not merely indispensable 3rd element > cultural values secure meaning, restricted to their standards of self-validity: poetry for poetry’s sake, art for art’s sake, science for science’s sake > [no longer question thus no longer spiritual?] > re: science and situation of university, a situation unchanged despite some cleansing [Nazi?]

HDG.DL.content: [in metaphysical aesthetics] art work an object for our feelings/ideas, artist the subject related to his work as object: a treacherous framework (verfänglich), can capture (einfangen) all other kinds of experience of art & its nature > Iki is the gracious (Anmutende)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: [in metaphysical aesthetics] art work an object for our feelings/ideas, artist the subject related to his work as object: a treacherous framework (verfänglich), can capture (einfangen) all other kinds of experience of art & its nature > Iki is the gracious (Anmutende)

HDG.LP.content: soul: great giver of life > everything that is alive is painful > pain is the animator (Beseelende) [cf. 180 the soul is the animator] > only the soulful fulfills destiny, capable, gifted as such, of joining in harmony the mutual bearing (wechselweisen Sichtragens) by which all living things belong > relation of fitness (Bezug des Taugens), all that lives is fit, i.e. good: good is good painfully > only true in pain > because pain is converse, kann das Lebende sein Mitanwesendes in seiner jeweiligen Art verbergend entbergen [sheltering concealment], wahr-haft [preservation/truth] sein lassen [truth as letting beings truly be what they are]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: soul: great giver of life > everything that is alive is painful > pain is the animator (Beseelende) [cf. 180 the soul is the animator] > only the soulful fulfills destiny, capable, gifted as such, of joining in harmony the mutual bearing (wechselweisen Sichtragens) by which all living things belong > relation of fitness (Bezug des Taugens), all that lives is fit, i.e. good: good is good painfully > only true in pain > because pain is converse, kann das Lebende sein Mitanwesendes in seiner jeweiligen Art verbergend entbergen [sheltering concealment], wahr-haft [preservation/truth] sein lassen [truth as letting beings truly be what they are]

HDG.WL.content: Sage: showing, pointing out, signaling (Jean Paul called phenomena of nature “spiritual pointer” or “spiritual index finger”) > Das Wesende der Sprach ist die Sage als die Zeige > in view of Gefüge der Sage, showing not exclusively/decisively property of human activity: Das Sichzeigen kennzeichnet als Erscheinen das An- und Abwesen des Anwesenden jeglicher Art und Stufe [presence still magnetizes presence/absence: self-showing marks the appearance of every kind/rank of presence/absence of all that is present] > even when man accomplishes showing, showing preceded by an indiction that it can be shown [beyond human] > must think of human saying like this to give adequate definition des Wesenden in all speaking
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Sage: showing, pointing out, signaling (Jean Paul called phenomena of nature “spiritual pointer” or “spiritual index finger”) > Das Wesende der Sprach ist die Sage als die Zeige > in view of Gefüge der Sage, showing not exclusively/decisively property of human activity: Das Sichzeigen kennzeichnet als Erscheinen das An- und Abwesen des Anwesenden jeglicher Art und Stufe [presence still magnetizes presence/absence: self-showing marks the appearance of every kind/rank of presence/absence of all that is present] > even when man accomplishes showing, showing preceded by an indiction that it can be shown [beyond human] > must think of human saying like this to give adequate definition des Wesenden in all speaking

HDG.OHF.content: Schleiermacher reduced (eingeschränkt) comprehensive/living manner of hermeneutics (Augustine) to “art (technique [Kunstlehre]) of understanding,” discipline connected w/ grammar/rhetoric
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Schleiermacher reduced (eingeschränkt) comprehensive/living manner of hermeneutics (Augustine) to “art (technique [Kunstlehre]) of understanding,” discipline connected w/ grammar/rhetoric

HDG.OHF.content: Heidegger believes it is best [why?] to treat everything said in today’s philosophy as pure/incontrovertible truth, not interested in truth/falsity of proposition but what goes on in this philosophy before it becomes what it is (was in dieser Philosophie vor sich geht) [hermeneutics as prior to philosophy] > methodology/logic couldn’t produce proper explanation because it would be a theory in same sense as this philosophy itself > Heidegger’s analysis will reactivate (nachvollziehen) step by step the context of its actualization (Vollzugszusammenhang) [cf. Derrida], bringing into relief how the object stands in view, how it is questioned, looked at, how concepts are being drawn (geschöpft) from it: ein Anspruch ganz primitiver Art (a quite primitive kind of claim/demand): can’t supply a basis (Boden) for this analysis
